result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffanie M Roewer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all prison wages at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or combination thereof to equal full time.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then taken as prescribed.

Defendant shall have no contact with the co-defendants:  Matthew F., Joseph K. or Austin B.

Defendant shall have no contact with anyone known to be using, possessing, selling or otherwise involved in drug use.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.  

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall inform the probation agent of any prescription medications prescribed and any change in prescriptions within 48 hours of the change.

timeConds.notes: Stayed and to be used at the discretion of the probation agent.  With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
